p: Pregnant women from Wuhan with a confirmed COVID‐19 infection showed similar clinical signs as non‐pregnant women. Their infants, delivered by caesarian section, remained uninfected; amniotic fluid, cord blood and breastmilk from these women were virus‐negative (Chen et al ., 2020a). In a second study from Wuhan, pregnant women showed mild pneumonia with fever as main symptom. Healthy children were born by caesarian section. One neonate showed a virus‐positive throat swab 36 h after birth, but developed only minor symptoms which resolved (Yu et al ., 2020). In a third study, infants born by caesarian section to infected mothers showed no symptoms, were negative for the virus in nasopharynx and displayed passive IgG antibodies. Surprisingly, two infants also showed specific IgM antibodies to the virus (Zeng et al ., 2020).
